comments.body: Generally, it's a bad idea to include `serialVersionUID`. It exists for particular reasons that don't really apply to Spark
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,52 @@

+package org.apache.spark.examples.ml;
+
+import java.io.Serializable;
+
+/**
+ * Unlabeled instance type, Spark SQL can infer schema from Java Beans.
+ */
+public class JavaDocument implements Serializable {
+
+  /** Serializable version identifier */
+  private static final long serialVersionUID = 7090547542135729169L;

comments.body: I don't think you need setters, but you probably need a no-arg constructor to make this JavaBeans-friendly
